direction.raw_text: . HOUSEBOAT - PREDAWN 2 Ellis skirts alongside the exterior wall of his room on a two- foot-wide section of decking. Ellis scurries to the mobile home section of the boat. He slips past a barbecue grill and settles underneath a lighted window. VOICES come from inside. direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pearls. Galen finds 'em in some of the mussel shells. Most of 'em ain't worth dick, but he likes to make necklaces for the girls. Come on, let's get that book. Neckbone walks into the trailer. Ellis stands up and retrieves the other two pearls out of the dirt. He crams them in his pocket and follows Neckbone inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NECKBONE'S TRAILER - CONTINUOUS 24 The trailer is decorated in the filth of a true bachelor pad. Neckbone makes his way to a bedroom. He tosses clothes and trash around to get to what he's looking for. A cardboard box. He pulls the box onto the bed and sifts through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want you goin' back out there by yourself. That river's scary enough with two people, and I don't trust that guy. (FINDS SOMETHING) Here it is. He takes out a hardback book. The slip reads, "The Confident Confidant, communicating with the opposite sex."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Galen said this really turned things around for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Ellis flips delicately through the manual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NECKBONE'S TRAILER - CONTINUOUS 25 Galen watches as the Girl's Dodge Shadow pulls away. The boys step out of the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really going back out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's the right thing to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...I'll be over in the mornin' then. Galen, his thumbs tucked under his armpits, walks back to the trailer. He passes the boys and notices the self-help book in Ellis' hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a good book. Be sure you do the worksheets in the back. Let's get some dinner Neck. Galen's gone inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call 'fore I come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Neckbone follows his uncle into the trailer. Ellis flips through his new book as he heads out of the trailer park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - NIGHT 26 By the time Ellis makes it to his houseboat, the sun has disappeared behind the horizon. He crosses the make-shift plank and enters through a screen door by the carport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - DEN - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS 27 Mary Lee flinches when she sees Ellis come through the door. Her face is flushed. Senior stands toe to toe with her. They stare at Ellis, who has paused in the doorway. He doesn't say anything, just looks curiously at his parents. Senior storms past Ellis and is out the door. Ellis steps further into the den. Mary Lee tries to straighten herself, patting down her hair and dabbing at her eyes with the back of her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay momma?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She walks into the kitchen keeping Ellis at her back. She turns on the sink and begins scrubbing at a dish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you need me to fix you somethin'? Have you eaten?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right. Mary Lee shuts off the water and lets the dish rest in the sink. She turns to Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna turn in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay momma. Mary Lee slips past him and enters her bedroom. The door closes and Ellis is left alone in the den. It's quiet. He waits, looking at the door his mother just closed. Ellis walks into the kitchen and eases open a cabinet door. Checking over his shoulder, he zips his backpack open and fills it with CANNED FOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOM BLANKENSHIP'S HOUSEBOAT - DAY 28 Hands pump the stock of a high-powered pellet gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , white hair cut high and tight wearing a short-sleeve button up, takes careful aim with the pellet gun. Tom sits in a lawn chair atop the roof of his houseboat. He squeezes his left eye shut. A snake's head pokes out of the water about 15 yards off his boat. The head makes for a target no bigger than a thumb. Tom's left eye snaps open and he fires. The pellet rips through the snake's head. Its body floats to the surface. Tom takes account of his shot as he pumps the air rifle. He scans the water for more targets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - CONTINUOUS 29 Ellis watches Tom Blankenship from across the bayou. Tom's boat sits directly opposite Ellis', separated by 30 yards of muddy brown water. Ellis leans against a post under the carport. His backpack resting at his feet, he holds the Walkie-Talkie in his hand. Senior works behind him washing utensils in the outdoor sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about Tom Blankenship?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Senior doesn't turn around from his work at the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Blankenship, what do you know about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He looks lonely over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people move to this river to work on it, and some move here to be left alone. Senior makes his way to the ice machine and begins scooping ice into a large white cooler. Mary Lee emerges from the houseboat dressed for work, a secretarial job. Senior stops what he's doing to watch her. She walks over to Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's sit down for dinner tonight okay? Will you make it home by seven?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes ma'am. She walks off the boat without a glance in Senior's direction. He trails her with his eyes before going back to digging in the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis looks back at Tom. The Walkie SQUAWKS out several A29 loud BEEPS. Ellis crams it in his backpack and runs off the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye Dad. Senior holds a hand up but never looks up from his work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND SHORE - DAY 30 Water laps at the shore of the island. Ellis and Neckbone drag their boat onto the muddy bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you think he's at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we should try the boat. They head for the treeline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE OF BOAT TREE - DAY 31 The boys emerge from the woods, their attention focused up to the boat hovering in the tree some twenty feet above them. Ellis notices the remnants of a fire on the ground. A log pushed up next to it for a seat. Ellis kicks at the ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like he made camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking up to the boat) You think he's up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I didn't know if ya'll'd come back. The boys spin around. They survey the woods but no one's there. Their eyes drift up to find Mud sitting in a tree, his legs dangle off a branch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doin'? Mud bounds down, stepping from limb to trunk to the ground. It's an agile move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try to never sleep in the same place twice. What you got there? Mud motions with his head to the backpack in Ellis' hand. Ellis holds it out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought you some food. Mud looks at the backpack, but doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mud takes the backpack and walks over to the ashes of his campfire. He squats with his back to the boys and unzips the bag. Hunkered down, Mud's shirttail rides up over the lip of his jeans revealing a PISTOL at his backside. Ellis sees this and motions to Neckbone. The boys stand their ground, cautious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I owe you boys. Keeping the bag in hand, Mud takes a seat on the stump behind him. He pulls out a selection of canned food; pumpkin pie filling, evaporated milk, green beans. He grabs the beans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was gonna try runnin' a trot line today. See how far that'd get me. Mud removes a good-sized folding knife from his pocket and makes short order of the can lid. He tips the can up letting the beans fall into his mouth. Juice flows down his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd been rationin' what I had...green bean never tasted so good. The can is quickly emptied, juice running down Mud's chin. He straightens his back, choking down the final swallow. He sees the boys staring at him and catches himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got that pistol for? Mud wipes off his chin, realizing the boys have been studying him. He closes the knife and tucks it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For protection. Mud gets up, heads for a duffel bag tucked under a nearby tree. The boys pivot, keeping Mud in front of them. Mud notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll don't have to be afraid of me. I have two ways to protect myself out here. This shirt, and this pistol. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are fierce powers at work in the world boys. Good, evil, poor luck, best luck. Men have to take advantage where they can. Mud removes a spool of fishing line and a small plastic tackle box. He scoops up the duffel bag and heads into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll comin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neckbone looks to Ellis, who walks after Mud into the 32 trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's this guy you're waitin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not waitin' for a guy. I'm waitin' on my girlfriend. Juniper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she hot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best lookin' girl I've ever seen. Hands down. Blonde hair. Long legs. She's like a dream you don't want to wake up from. She's got birds tattooed on her hands, here. Mud stops, points to the area on the top of his right hand, between his thumb and pointer finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nightingales. Good luck birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That a good luck snake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it is not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate snakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because God made them for us to fear. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a thing we knew to be afraid of before we even got into this world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They emerge from the woods onto the downstream coast of 33 the island. It looks different than the other shoreline. A large swath of red clay angles sharply into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cherokee would wrap snake skin around their pregnant women's bellies. Induce labor, scare the child out. Here. He fetches a length of rope out of the duffel bag and tosses it to Neckbone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set that `round your bed at night. Snake won't cross braided rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. (nods to Mud's tattoo) So what's that for then? Mud walks to a tree branch that has grown out over the bank, nearly resting in the water. He sets a trot line from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A reminder. Don't get bit. I was
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swimmin' `bout a mile up from here. Me and Juniper. Sonofabitch swam right up under me, bit me just below the armpit. June got me out, got me to a clinic. Doctor said I shoulda been dead in twenty minutes. Took us an hour just to get back to town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd they do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gave me antivenom. For a cotton mouth. See here. Mud shows the tattoo on top of his right hand. He points out the two cotton blossoms bulging from the snake's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Problem with antivenom is they can only give it to you once. It's made from horse blood. Your body would reject it a second time. The cure ends up being more dangerous than the poison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happens if you get bit again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I die, or just sweat it out. Neckbone, not buying it, looks at Ellis and taps his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta go help Neck's uncle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never said your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud. You can call me Mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Neckbone tosses the braided rope back. It lands at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here you go, Mud. I think you need that worse than I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be all right. The boys disappear back into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GARY'S ELECTRIC SHOP - DAY 34 A switch clicks "ON". BLINDING LIGHT emits from two FLOOD LAMPS encased in plastic shells. The switch clicks "OFF" and the lights dim to the dull orange glow of their filaments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look bright enough. The owner of the shop, an ELECTRICIAN(62), holds up a metal bar with the lamps affixed by bolts at either end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should be. I rigged DC power up through marine batteries. Makes it portable. Gave you a rigging bar to set on your shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you really think these'll work under water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In theory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GARY'S ELECTRIC/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT - CONTINUOUS 35 Ellis and Neckbone sit on the tailgate of Galen's truck. The Gary's Electric sign hangs behind them. Neckbone focuses on a carburetor in his hand. Ellis stares across the street at the Piggly Wiggly parking lot where the roving GROUP of TEENAGERS have collected for the afternoon. The Teenagers are up to their typical gossip and minor offenses. Ellis has zeroed in on May Pearl again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You start datin' I bet her dad'll give you a free pick-up truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about that. Ellis watches as the same Skinny Kid from before tries to flirt with her. She's not having it. He pops her bra strap before landing the final straw, a smack on her ass. She turns and swats at him. Seeing this, Ellis is on his feet and crossing the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin' on? Ellis doesn't turn back. Neckbone reluctantly sets the carburetor down and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT - CONTINUOUS 36 MAY PEARL Stop it! She shoves the Skinny Kid, but he continues laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey. Ellis taps the Kid on the shoulder. As he turns, Ellis
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: him in the face. The Kid, completely taken off guard, stumbles and trips to the ground. Some older, tougher looking GUYS see this and begin laughing at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit Pryor, get off your ass. Pryor collects himself and gets off the ground. Ego bruised, he walks off mumbling. The Older Kids keep riding him. May Pearl sizes up Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't have to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was messin' with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I know you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Ellis. That's Neck. Neckbone waves by wagging a finger in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went to Junior High with you, before you went to High School.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fourteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fourteen? You know you just punched a Senior?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you're pretty tough. Ellis shrugs, not wanting to deny it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm May Pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin'. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Something catches Neckbone's attention. He cranes his neck forward to get a better look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch...Ellis? Ellis breaks away from his conversation with May Pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Neckbone nods to a cheap motel called the EXECUTIVE INN located on the opposite side of the Piggly Wiggly parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: , a truly beautiful woman squeezed into tight jeans and a low cut top, makes her way from the motel parking lot to the Piggly Wiggly. She passes in front of the cluster of Teenagers. All of the boys have taken note. Some cat calls from the crowd. Juniper, without facing the Teenagers, gives them the finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever seen that girl before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Did you see her hands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Ellis catches himself and turns back to May Pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. We know a guy we think might know that girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of May Pearl's calls out to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May Pearl! Let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'll see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you can find my phone number, you should call it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can find it. May Pearl walks over to her friend. Ellis watches her go, but then remembers Juniper. He turns to Neckbone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Into the Piggly Wiggly. She came from the motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna go see if it's her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go check on Galen. We'll pick you up out front. Ellis heads for the Piggly Wiggly. Neckbone calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd she say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wants me to call her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PIGGLY WIGGLY - DAY 37 Ellis walks past the grocery aisles looking for the girl. He spots her by the potato chips. He tucks behind a display of stacked cans and watches. Juniper reaches for a bag of chips, birds tattooed on her hand. Ellis smiles. It's her, and she really is beautiful. She turns down the aisle, coming right for him. He pretends to peruse the canned food and notices that it's a big display of Beanie Weenie. He grabs two handfuls as she passes. Ellis takes the cans to an open register. As a CASHIER scans and bags his items, he cranes his neck looking for her. She's disappeared into another section of the store. Ellis pays in crumpled cash. A horn HONKS. He sees Galen's truck idling out front. He grabs the bag and runs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GALEN'S TRUCK/PIGGLY WIGGLY PARKING LOT - CONTINUOUS 38 Neckbone waits at the open passenger door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was it her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's her. I saw the tattoos. He wasn't lyin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No he wasn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - NIGHT 39 By the time Ellis makes it back home, the sun has gone from the sky. He crosses the makeshift plank to board his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Home for dinner? Ellis is startled by his father's voice. Senior sits in a lawn chair under the eaves of the carport. He's hidden in shadow, save for a red glow from the tip of his cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you hidin' for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't hidin'. He notices Senior tip back a pint of liquor and set it at his feet. Ellis opens the screen door leading inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come over here. Ellis lets the door fall shut and skulks over to a beam that supports the carport. He leans into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I love you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work you hard 'cause life is work. You know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Mamma's been talkin' 'bout movin' in town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seems set on it. Wants to separate. She may ask me for a divorce. This hits Ellis like a ton of bricks. He rights himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that mean for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means enjoy the river son. Enjoy it while you live on it, 'cause this way a life isn't long for this world. Game and fish's 'bout made certain of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you and me can still live out here. Game and fish can't take your boat. Not while you're still in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The houseboat's in your mother's name. Her daddy give it to her not me. If she wants to leave it, Game and Fish has ever' right to take this boat apart board by board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that ain't right. You work outta here. We got the ice machine, the traps. What are we supposed to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I said, this is your mother's business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't no townie. I ain't livin' like that. Senior takes a slow pull off the bottle. Ellis' mind races.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've let you down. A man should be in charge of his own affairs, but I haven't worked it like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But ya'll are married. Ya'll are s'posed to love each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about that anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ellis is speechless. After a moment, he turns to go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? He stops and turns back to his father. Senior tries to express a sentiment he doesn't have the words for. Ellis continues inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - DEN - CONTINUOUS 40 Mary Lee sits hunched at the made dinner table. She runs her finger around the rim of a half empty glass of iced tea. It's a full spread with fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and a salad. The table is set for two. She's been waiting. Ellis lets the front door slam shut behind him. She sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're late. Ellis doesn't speak, he doesn't look at her. He enters his room and shuts the door. He's heard the news and she knows it. Mary Lee's face drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' ROOM - CONTINUOUS 41 Ellis slings his backpack down, pacing the small room. He stops and leans his forehead against the door. The sound of his Mother clearing the table seeps through. He kicks the door, cracking its shitty composite wood. His face flushed and his breathing heavy, he slides to a seat. On the verge of hyperventilating, he stares out the dark bedroom window trying to get control of his breathing. Ellis looks at his backpack. It has spilled open revealing a can of Beanie Weenie. Ellis studies the can. He looks back to the window. His breathing settles. Quickly, he scoops up the backpack and heads out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MISSISSIPPI RIVER - NIGHT 42 It's pitch black. The only light comes from the moon's reflection off the surface of the water. Ellis, eyes wide, navigates the small boat through choppy black water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND SHORE - NIGHT 43 Ellis struggles to pull the boat onto shore. Leaving it half in the water, Ellis looks around. No sign of Mud. He sizes up the dark woods. He removes a flashlight from his backpack and shines it down the shorelines. Still nothing. Ellis follows the beam of light into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS - NIGHT 44 Ellis stands at the creek that cuts through the island. He can make out a campfire glowing through trees in the distance. A RUSTLING behind him. He swings the light around. Nothing but trees. Ellis takes a deep breath. Finding the log to cross, he shines his light down into the creek. The nest of snakes show their backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE OF BOAT TREE - NIGHT 45 A campfire burns at the base of the tree. The firelight illuminates the belly of the boat that rests 20 feet above. Ellis, his flashlight off, crouches behind a tree and watches the campsite. There is no one there. He looks into the black forest behind him, thinks of going back. A twig snaps in the distance and he's back on guard. Ellis nervously scans the woods before finally stepping into the light of the campfire. The SOUND of a gun's hammer drawing back CLICKS behind him. Ellis freezes. Mud emerges from the trees, a .45 extended toward Ellis' back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? Ellis, still frozen, slowly turns to him. Mud huffs out a laugh and drops the pistol to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doin' out here? Ellis slowly raises the backpack in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got you some Beanie Weenie. Mud tucks the pistol into his jeans and accepts the backpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I appreciate that, but I didn't expect you out here at night. Mud takes a seat on the log and transfers the cans into his own duffel bag. He holds up a can of the Beanie Weenie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that. You really know how to do somebody right. I didn't wanna say anything before, but it's hard to make a meal out of pumpkin pie filling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all my mom had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not complainin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get one of those?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're yours to begin with. Ellis sits as Mud hands him a can. They eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed my dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been out here too long. Mud laughs. Finishing the can, he takes a half-smoked cigarette from his shirt pocket. He pulls a twig from the fire for a light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl you're waitin' on, she's your girlfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juniper. Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you meet her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We grew up together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you love her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. The first time I saw her was on this river. Just up from here. She saved my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the snake bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I was younger than you are now, but when I came to in the hospital and she was there, it was like the world split open, came back together new. Everything changed. I knew from then on I'd do anything for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why aren't ya'll married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've asked. Several times. Marriage just doesn't work for some people. Ellis thinks on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad says my parents may be gettin' a divorce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to hear that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it happens, and my mom moves us off the river, they say the government can come take our boat away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who says that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody. They passed a law so you can't sell your boat. Can't rent it. If the owner leaves, they got you. Game and Fish want `em off the river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never been one to trust the government on matters of personal property, but if your parents love each other, there's always a chance. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People just sometimes forget why they fell in love in the first place. Ellis watches Mud toke the cigarette nub. He's really getting all he can from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw Juniper today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't talk to her, but she had the birds tattooed on her hand like you said. You were right. She's pretty. Mud stands, surprised by the news. He walks to the other side of the fire so his back is to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you see her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the Piggly Wiggly. I think she's stayin' at a motel by there. The Executive Inn. Mud looks at Ellis through the fire. He takes a drag and smiles at the boy. The hole from his missing tooth shows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good news. Real good news. Mud paces, slowly. He's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does she know you're out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We picked another place to meet. Couple days from now. Mud walks back to the log and sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna go tonight? I can give you a ride up river. Mud looks at Ellis, nodding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow. I'll go tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need me to come get you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. I can manage. Hell I got out here didn't I? Ellis smiles. They sit in silence. Ellis stares up at the boat hanging over them, its peeling hull lit by the firelight. Mud pinches the ash from the end of his cigarette, places the stub back in his shirt pocket. Noticing Ellis, Mud tilts his head back to take in the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a helluva thing. Mud pauses, his mind working on something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helluva thing. The two sit by the campfire staring up at the suspended boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' ROOM - MORNING 46 Mary Lee knocks on her way into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time to get up. She begins picking clothes off the floor. Ellis, in bed, raises up on his elbows. He's tired from a late night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Saturday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to Wal-Mart. I need you to come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. She pulls the covers off of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MARY LEE'S CAR/INTERSTATE - DAY 47 The two ride in an awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ellis stares at the farmland passing by outside as Mary Lee steers the compact Toyota down a four-lane interstate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis I know what your father told you last night. That's not what I wanted. I wanted to sit you down and talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you wanna talk about? You want to leave and that means they can tear up our house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've spent my whole life on that boat. I don't think it's too much to ask for your... Mary Lee is interrupted by a line of traffic backed up in front of her. She slows to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. I hope no one's hurt. There are flashing police lights up ahead. Ellis tries to see what's going on but can't make anything out past the line of cars. They inch forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying there are two sides to this. I haven't made up my mind about anything because I want you to be involved in my decision, but I need a change Ellis. I deserve one. As they approach the flashing lights, they see three State Trooper vehicles parked to funnel traffic down to one lane. The STATE TROOPERS stop each car, checking the trunks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they're searching people. A Trooper signals Mary Lee to pull up to a stop. Two other Troopers approach her vehicle. The first begins looking in her back windows as the second leans down to speak to her. She lowers her window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you open the trunk please ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mary Lee pulls the lever by her knee, and the second Trooper walks around the back of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you picked up or seen any hitchhikers today ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir. The Trooper produces a flier with a color photo on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen this man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir. The Trooper leans over and holds the paper out to Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, have you seen this man? Ellis looks at the photo. It's of Mud. He looks exactly the same as he did last night, down to the shirt. In the photo, Mud's smiling, revealing his missing tooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've had reports that he's in this area. If you see him, call 9-1-1 immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will officer. The Trooper pulls his head from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd he do?! The Trooper bends back down and looks at Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move along please. Mary Lee pulls forward and speeds back up on the interstate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lord. (rolls up her window) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you feel about moving into town with me? (NO ANSWER) Please don't tell your father this, but I've been looking at a couple of places. I know it would be a big adjustment for you, but it might end up being something you like. You know living on the river isn't exactly everyone's idea of the good life. Ellis? He looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you even listening to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' ROOM - DAY 48 Ellis busts through the door, grabs his backpack and is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSEBOAT - CONTINUOUS 49 Ellis is off the houseboat and running up the bank. He heads down the dirt path, grabbing the Walkie Talkie out of his backpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the Walkie) Neck! Neck, pick up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVERBANK - DAY 50 Ellis removes branches and readies the flat bottom boat to launch. The sound of Neckbone's bike arrives before he does. Neckbone crests the sand covered slope. He dismounts and starts to chain the bike up to a tree trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the big deal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom and I were headed to Wal- Mart on 165. There was a roadblock with state troopers. They searched our car and showed us a picture of Mud. They're lookin' for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it! I told you that crazy sonofabitch was trouble. Did they say what he did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So'd you tell `em where he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That's why I called you. We gotta warn him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's goin' to get Juniper today. I went out there last night and told him where we saw her. He needs to know people are lookin' for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he doesn't know that already? Jesus Ellis, why do you think he's on that island? You don't even know what he's wanted for. Ellis climbs in the boat and Neckbone yanks his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis! I'm serious. We don't know who this guy is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loves her Neck. He told me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a shit who he loves. Ellis starts the motor and waits for his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not dangerous. Reluctantly, Neckbone throws his leg into the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds like a shitload of state troopers think different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE OF BOAT TREE - DAY 51 Ellis and Neckbone emerge from the woods at Mud's campsite. They scan nearby tree limbs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No tellin' where the hell he's been sleepin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He may already be gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey! The boys look straight up. Mud leans over the edge of the boat above them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up here! Mud drops them a rope with knots tied in it. Ellis starts inching his way up. Neckbone begrudgingly follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BOAT IN TREE - CONTINUOUS 52 Ellis pulls himself over the edge of the boat. He finds Mud sitting in the swivel chair behind the steering wheel. He writes in an open spiral notebook with a black Sharpie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna have to go back on our deal for the boat. I don't feel good about it, but I don't see any other way outta what I'm into. Neckbone makes his way on board. Mud has pulled a panel off the steering column. Exposed wires dangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you know about the state troopers? He looks up from his notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What state troopers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ones spreadin' your picture all over the place. Stoppin' cars on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: searchin' for your ass. Mud factors this in and then goes back to writing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know about that, but it doesn't surprise me. There plenty of folks lookin' for me right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shot a man. Killed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mud stands and walks to the back of the boat. The boys' eyes follow him cautiously. Mud lifts a hatch at the back that would typically house the batteries and engine wiring. There's nothing left but a hole into the trees. He makes a note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I didn't tell ya'll sooner, but I was hopin' to be gone before anything came of it. Didn't want you involved. Mud turns to really face them for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll have been real good to me. You're the only friends I got out here. If the state troopers have
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blocked, they'll have others blocked too. I won't get anywhere in a car. I want to try takin' this boat down, see if we can get it in the water. Ellis and Neckbone stand their ground. They don't say anything. Mud walks back to the steering column. He drops to his knees and fiddles with the wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a boat like this I can make it to the gulf in two days. I could get anywhere from there. But I'd need a boat at least this big to make it on open water. It's got no title, no owner, nobody lookin' for it. It's my best shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who'd you kill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a bad piece of business. Ya'll don't need to hear about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to hear about it. Mud sits up. He looks at Ellis, deciding how much to tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juniper made a mistake. She hooked up with a guy. He was no good. His name was Hutchins. Family owns a chain of restaurants down in Texas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was around, but me and Juniper were on the outs. She met this Hutchins, he sold her on some lies. Got her pregnant. That's when he started showin' who he really was. He dropped June down a flight of stairs after whoopin' her half to death. She lost the baby. He made it so the doctors think she can't have children anymore. There're things you can get away with in this world and things you can't. I tracked him down at a motel just outside of San Antonio. He was there with another woman. That's where it happened. Mud's done with his story. He goes back to the wiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand if you can't help me anymore, but I need this boat. And I need to get it in the water fast. After a moment, he sits up and wipes sweat from his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've made a list. Things we'll need. What do ya'll think? Ellis takes time to consider everything. He looks at Neckbone, who has a disgruntled look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did it for her? To protect her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Ellis nods. Mud looks over at Neckbone, who still has the disgruntled look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you want us to run around, stickin' our necks out, gettin' everything you need, just so you can take our boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's about it. Mud removes a cigarette butt and sparks it with a lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we get out of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? Neckbone looks to Ellis, judging his bargaining position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about that pistol? Mud eyes the boy, pulling on the nub of cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only got two things out here worth anything. This shirt... Mud pulls the pistol from the back of his jeans. Neckbone tenses, but relaxes when Mud splays it out on an open palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this pistol. I can't give you the shirt `cause I need it for protection, but if you help me get this boat in the water, the pistol's yours. Neckbone squinches his face in thought, sizing up this trade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A forty five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we could work a deal like that. Neckbone steps forward to grab the pistol, but Mud puts it back in his jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get this thing floatin' first. Neckbone looks over at Ellis, who shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mud smiles, flashing his missing tooth. He spits in his palm and holds it out to Neckbone. Neckbone, not sure about taking the spit hand, reluctantly shakes. Mud rips a page from the notebook and hands it to Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll scrounge what you can off this list, but if we're gonna get this done right we'll need more help. Can you fetch Tom for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom Blankenship? Mud has smoked down to the filter. He crushes the butt into his palm and puts it back in his shirt pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hopin' to let that old assassin stay put, but we'll need him to get things ya'll can't. Can you find him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know where he lives, but I've never spoke to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell him my name. He'll know you're serious. Ellis folds the list up. He and Neckbone start down the rope as Mud goes back to the wiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys? (THEY PAUSE) Thanks. Ellis nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lose my pistol. They continue down the rope. Mud continues his work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHELLY'S OXBOW - DAY 53 Ellis steers to the southern mouth of Shelly's Oxbow, the bend in the river that holds he and Tom Blankenship's houseboats, among others. He grounds the boat just shy of entering the Oxbow and steps over Neckbone to hop onto the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You comin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll watch the boat. Ellis scans the woods that populate the patch of land wedged between the river and this short tributary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful. Galen always said that old man's crazy. Neckbone keeps his seat as Ellis darts into the woods
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOM'S WOODS - DAY 54 Ellis prowls around the small pine trees and bushes. He pauses, seeing the entrance to Tom Blankenship's boat. Something moves on the houseboat. Ellis hunkers down behind a bush. He sees Tom wrapping cable onto a metal spool. Ellis is nervous. He checks over his shoulder, nothing but woods. When he looks back to the boat, Tom is gone. In a crouch, Ellis moves closer. Taking a deep breath, Ellis steps out from the cover of the pine trees and heads up a walkway that leads onboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Why you huntin' me? Ellis flinches. He turns to find Tom Blankenship standing at the edge of the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You deaf boy? I said why're you huntin' me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't huntin you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your business here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came to find you. I got a message for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Senior's boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got to say he can't tell me himself? Tom, rusty on pleasantries, brushes past Ellis as he heads inside the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It ain't from him. Ellis, not wanting to follow further, shouts from the planks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MUD SENT ME! There is a silence. Then footsteps. Tom reappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud sent you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked me to come get you. Tom straightens his back. He looks into the woods, searching for something he may have missed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your daddy know this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sir. Mud needs your help. Tom's mind churns on a series of facts unknown to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER - DAY 55 Neckbone bounces in the boat as it shifts in the choppy Mississippi water. His eyes are locked on the back of Tom's head. Tom rides stone faced in the front. Neckbone turns back to Ellis and raises his eyebrows as if to ask, "What's going on?". Ellis shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND SHORE - DAY 56 Ellis runs the boat on shore. Tom splashes into the ankle deep water and helps the boys drag it onto the bank. Ellis takes the lead, walking ahead and scanning the treeline. Mud steps out, just past the shadow of the woods. Ellis turns to Tom and points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is. Tom spits onto the muddy bank and makes his way toward Mud. Ellis and Neckbone stay by the boat and watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud watches Tom approaching. He corrects his posture and feebly attempts to smooth some wrinkles from his shirt. Tom stops in front of him, his eyes pinched in the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir. They stare at each other for a long moment. Neither one flinching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this distance, the boys can't hear what is being said, but they try and size up the situation through body language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think that's his dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In town. Got here yesterday. Tom lowers his head. Frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you out here like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The boys see Mud take a seat on a nearby stump. He's explaining something. Tom listens, standing over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't look like family. Ellis watches Mud as he gestures and speaks. He seems different. Younger. Mud stops talking. Tom scratches a hand through his white crew cut. He begins pointing a finger at Mud. His face is flushed and the sound of his voice carries to the boys, though still unintelligible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's really givin' it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud's head hangs as Tom shouts at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've spent your whole life followin' that girl! She's run you halfway cross the country and back, and for what? For this, left out on an island beggin' for help. A murderer. A thief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't no thief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you call it then? Don't even mention draggin' those boys into this. Do you have any idea what you're doin'? Waits for a response, but Mud gives none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ashamed of you. Mud looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't expect help from me. There's none to be given.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They see Tom turn his back on Mud and head toward the boat. Mud doesn't protest; he doesn't move. Tom brushes past Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ready. Tom shoves the boat back into the water. Neckbone helps him. Ellis looks back at Mud, who still hasn't moved from his stump. He goes to him. Tom sees this and stops pushing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis stops a good six feet back from where Mud sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right? Mud raises his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like we're on our own. He stands and takes a folded piece of paper from his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want you bein' the one to do this, but I can't see a way around it. I need to get this letter to Juniper. Could you take it to her for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to be careful. You can't just walk up and knock on her door, you hear me? You have to watch yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can handle it. Ellis steps forward and Mud hands over the note. Ellis takes it and walks back to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom stares at Ellis as he climbs on board. Tom looks back at Mud, who is watching him. He gives the boat a final shove before pulling himself in. They motor away. Tom doesn't look back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER/SHELLY'S OXBOW - MOVING - DAY 57 NECKBONE You Mud's daddy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud didn't have no daddy. No mother I ever knew of. He was livin' in the woods when I met him. Younger than you are now. Tom doesn't offer anymore. Neckbone thinks on his answer. Ellis kills the engine near the mouth of Shelly's Oxbow. Tom jumps down into the knee deep river and wades onto shore. He turns back to the boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya'll need to watch yourselves. Don't go gettin' into something you don't have any business in. Mud's into something you don't want any part of. I suggest you forget about him. Ellis and Neckbone don't respond. Tom, with a final admonishing look, disappears into the woods. Ellis cranks the motor and points the boat up river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER - MOVING - MOMENTS LATER 58 Edges of the notebook paper flap in the wind. Neckbone reads Mud's letter to Juniper. Ellis reaches the bank where they stash their boat. He shuts off the motor and let's them drift. Neckbone folds the letter back up and turns to face Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loves her. You can tell that much. You gonna take it to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him I would. Neckbone thinks about this seriously, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Could be a lot of trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still got that trailer you made for your bike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEWITT STREET - LATE AFTERNOON 59 Neckbone rides with Ellis on the back of his dirt bike. Cars and Trucks HONK and zip by them. Their speed is topped out at about 15 miles per hour. Mostly a result of the small
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: metal trailer they are towing behind the bike. One of Senior's white fish coolers sits in the trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXECUTIVE INN/PARKING LOT - LATE AFTERNOON 60 Parked in the far corner of the lot, Ellis sits on top of the white cooler eyeing the Executive Inn. Neckbone straddles the dirt bike. A handful of cars are parked at the motel; an old Honda, a pick-up, and a BLACK LINCOLN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say we start at the top, work our way down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. They each grab an end of the cooler and carry it across the lot toward a flight of stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys set the cooler down in front of the first room on the corner. Ellis checks over his shoulder, nothing strange. Ellis knocks. They wait. No answer. They pick the cooler up and walk to the next door. Knock. After a moment, a BLACK MAN in his late sixties opens the door wearing boxers and an undershirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sellin' fish. You wanna buy some?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fish? He looks at the two boys like they are insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want no damn fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He slams the door. They drag the cooler to the next door. As Ellis holds up his fist to knock, they hear a woman shouting a few doors down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! STOP! Ellis heads for the room. Neckbone drags the cooler after him. Ellis reaches the motel room door, which has been left ajar. He places his hand on it and lets it fall open.
