He's holding the grocery sack that was left on his houseboat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Mud, hearing the voice, quickly puts down his tools and turns to the woods. He smooths his clothes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you say there?! Ellis appears out of the dark, followed by Neckbone. Mud's eyes search the treeline for Juniper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you say Ellis? Ellis can't look him in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got that motor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Juniper okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't meet up with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? Was it Carver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't Carver. Mud straightens up, prepares for the news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin' on Ellis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was supposed to meet us on the side of the motel. She never showed up. We went asking for her. The motel clerk told us she went to a bar out on 61.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We tracked her down. She was there with another guy. (HESITATES) They were together. Mud's face drops. He walks to the fire and shakes a cooking pot resting in the coals. The pot bubbles with roof tar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She probably thought Carver was on to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knew the plan Mud. She just didn't show up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was she doin' with the other guy? Ellis hesitates, not wanting to say. Mud pushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What were they doin' Ellis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were playin' pool. Drinkin'. He was close up on her. They were laughin'. He kissed her on the neck. Mud nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's how it is. He takes the pot of roofing tar over to the boat and begins pasting some of the newly replaced boards with a flat stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want us to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go home Ellis. Ellis looks at Neckbone, then sets the grocery sack on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom left this for you. They slowly retreat into the woods and disappear. Mud turns back to the campfire and shoves the pot into the ashes. His eyes, soft and red, reflect the flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MISSISSIPPI RIVER - NIGHT 102 Ellis and Neckbone motor away from the island in the flat bottom boat. They look back at the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it's all right to leave him alone?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doubt it! Neckbone sees Ellis' concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll sleep over at your house tonight! We can check on him first thing tomorrow! Ellis nods. As they head further up river, the island grows smaller, silhouetted by the moonlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' ROOM - MORNING 103 Neckbone snores, sprawled out on top of a sleeping bag on the floor. Ellis sits up in bed with something on his mind. He gets up and steps gingerly over Neckbone to exit the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT - DEN - CONTINUOUS 104 The house is silent. Ellis slips into the kitchen and picks up the phone receiver mounted on the cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He pulls the cord out to stand with his face in the corner. He dials, waits, and speaks softly into the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Is May Pearl there...This is Ellis...I called yesterday, you give her my message?...My name is Ellis. I'm her boyfriend...Oh, she's asleep...I said she's asleep? The front door flies open. Senior storms headlong toward Ellis. He shouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Ellis turns as Senior yanks the phone by the cord. It snaps out of Ellis' hand and smashes apart on the floor. Ellis flinches at the sight of his father flying at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell have you been doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?!! Senior grabs Ellis by the arms and shoves him against the den wall. Mary Lee comes running from her room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! SENIOR DAMMIT! She slaps at her husband's arms and back. He swats her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell her. You tell her what you've been up to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're sayin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your hands off him Senior! Senior keeps Ellis pinned to the wall with his left hand. He opens up and addresses Mary Lee with his right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .J. Crawford said a boat motor went missin' from his stock yard. Said his daughter saw this one and his friend haulin' it off. This makes Mary Lee pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you tell me right now, did you steal that motor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't steal it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lie to me again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We thought it was junk. We didn't think it was worth anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? A cool anger rushes over Senior's face. He releases Ellis and takes a step back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me I raised a thief?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a thief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take property that's not yours. Property that belongs to another man. That junk is his livelihood. I'm ashamed of you. Ellis drops his head. His face flushed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Senior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Mary Lee) Shut your mouth. You think you can take things and not have him see it? Neither one of you has any respect for a man's livelihood. A life that puts clothes on your back and food in your stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you blame this on me. One doesn't have a thing to do with the other and you know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me what I know. If you can steal a man's life out from under him in front of your son and think he won't take a lesson from it than you're even dumber than you look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Senior volleys a finger at Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's raisin' you a snake like herself, and you can curl up with her `fore I give a damn. You just remember this when you watch them rip this house apart board by board. You Hear Me! Mary Lee slaps Senior hard. He turns to her, saying nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a man who's never had the strength to support his own life. I never asked you for a thing, and I've never took a thing from you that I couldn't provide for on my own. If they do tear my home apart the only joy I'll have in my heart is knowin' that they'll be tearing you out of my life for good. She wipes her eyes and turns her attention to Ellis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis. You'll return that motor from where you found it and you'll apologize in person to the man you took it from. I won't hear about anything like this again. Mary Lee walks to the front door. She collects her purse and keys and exits quietly. Senior and Ellis stand in silence, which feels even more uncomfortable than the shouting. Ellis finally speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't take that motor back. But I'll pay him for it. I'll pay him what he wants for it. Senior, stoic, pivots his body away from the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what you do Ellis. Senior retreats to the bedroom. Ellis is left alone in the wake. He looks to his room. The door opens slightly and Neckbone takes a step out. Neckbone doesn't say anything. He just bites at his lip, sympathy for his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND SHORE LANDING - DAY 105 Charred hunks of driftwood smolder in a ruined pile on the sand. They constitute the remains of a large bonfire. Neckbone and Ellis stare at the ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a bonfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess he didn't care about bein' seen. Ellis kicks at one of the burned logs. He bends down and finds the bottle of Jack Daniels, smashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had something else on his mind. Come on. Ellis leads Neckbone into the treeline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS/CREEK - DAY 106 Mud's yellow shirt hangs, partially ripped, from a tree branch. Ellis pulls it off the limb. Concerned, they head deeper into the woods, over the fallen tree trunk that bridges the creek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS AND SOUTHERN SHORE - DAY 107 The boys watch Mud through the trees at a distance. He's crouched on the deck of the boat fiddling with wiring. Mud, giving no sign he sees the boys, yells out to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are ya'll hidin' for? Mud drops the wiring and scales down to the bank. They emerge from the woods. Ellis carries the yellow shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We found your shirt. Ellis tosses it to him. Mud tosses it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it. I don't need it anymore. Mud goes to the motor at the rear to tinker with more wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We saw what's left of your bonfire. (NO RESPONSE) Somebody could've seen you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do some drinkin' last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did a lot of drinkin' last night. Mud stops and walks over to address the boys. His face is pale and his manner is curt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neck I'm gonna need you here to get the motor runnin'. Ellis I need you to do something else for me. Mud removes a folded note from his back pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you to take this to Juniper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay Mud. Ellis takes the letter. Mud goes back to the boat motor. He motions to Neckbone to join him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still takin' Juniper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a dream last night. I saw Juniper laying in a field with another man. They were making love. I walked out into the field. Walked toward `em. I was so angry the tips of my ears were burnin'. That's how I knew I was gonna kill this man. But when I got up close enough, I saw that the man she was with had tattoos on his back, just like mine. I moved in closer and the guy turns his head back toward me. Hair for hair, dead truth, the guy she was with was me. Mud ducks back under the motor. Ellis looks at Neckbone, worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll finish the boat, but I'd be surprised if I live long enough to sail on it. A vision of yourself is a sure sign of death. Neck can you grab me a socket wrench? Neckbone and Ellis walk to the toolbox sitting nearby. They crouch by it, speaking quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You be all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I borrow your bike? Neckbone fishes the key out of his pocket. Hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tump it. Ellis nods. Neckbone walks over to Mud with the toolbox. Letter in hand, Ellis gives a final look toward Mud's labor and walks back into the woods. On his way, he stops to hang Mud's shirt on a tree branch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MISSISSIPPI RIVER - DAY 108 Ellis rides in the flat bottom boat alone. He stares at the letter in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PIGGLY WIGGLY - DAY 109 Ellis sits on the dirt bike. He scans the parking lot. No black Lincoln. His eyes stop on a green pick-up. Miller, sits inside. Ellis looks around and finds a pay phone nearby. He gets off the bike and walks toward it. Ellis removes the flier Carver gave him. He dials a phone number copied at the bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the phone) Hello. I saw the guy you're lookin' for...Yeah, he's crazy lookin'. Saw him at the Wal-mart outside of Gillet. He was buyin' some beanie weenie...'bout five minutes ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ellis hangs up the phone. He walks back over to the bike, climbs on and waits. After a moment, he watches as Miller's green pick-up pulls out of the Piggly Wiggly parking lot and races away. Ellis cranks the bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXECUTIVE INN/JUNIPER'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 110 Ellis, at a slight crouch, keeps his eyes on the Piggly Wiggly parking lot. The green pick-up is nowhere in sight. At Juniper's door, he knocks twice, softly. The door swings opens. Juniper stands there, holding a lit cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was wonderin' when I'd see you. Ellis checks over his shoulder and walks inside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXECUTIVE INN/JUNIPER'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 111 The bed is unmade and the room is a bit of a mess. Ellis keeps his head down. Juniper closes the door and takes a seat on the edge of the bed. She grabs the remote control and mutes the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about last night. I didn't plan on... Before she can finish Ellis has fished the letter out of his pocket and holds it out to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm supposed to give this to you. Juniper takes the letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Ellis goes to the door. He pulls the bedroom curtain back slightly to check the parking lot. The coast is clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you read it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I gotta go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? He turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you had to do was be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why'd you even come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here to leave with him. I really did. But now...now I guess I just came to say goodbye. His eyes fall to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know us Ellis. We've been headin' this way for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know he'd do anything for you. She puts her cigarette out in a Coke can on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really believe that? Ellis nods. Juniper speaks to him gently, almost smiling. It's a look of resignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mud's a born liar. That's what makes him so likable. He makes people feel good about themselves. He's a romantic. I don't think he means to hurt people. But when people get close to him, that's what happens. Ellis watches her as she goes to the sink and wets the end of a towel. She dabs her eyes at the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do love him Ellis. But I can't spend the rest of my life runnin' with him. I may not know what kind of life I want, but I know that's not it. Her back to him, Ellis watches as she unfolds the letter and begins reading. He angles himself to see her face in the mirror. He watches her eyes scanning the words. No emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She finishes, folds the letter back up, then turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says it's over. Tell him I've packed my things. Tell him I've gone. She takes a deep breath and smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye Ellis. Ellis turns and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXECUTIVE INN/JUNIPER'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS 112 Ellis, dejected, no longer bothers to look over his shoulder. He walks to the staircase but stops there. Feeling the need to say something more, he goes back to her room. He puts his knuckle flat on the door but hesitates. He leans over and looks through the window. The sliver in the curtain gives him a glimpse. Juniper is curled up on the end of the bed. She is sobbing. Ellis watches longer than he should before pulling his head away from the window. Ellis heads back downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INTERSECTION/SONIC DRIVE-IN - DAY 113 Ellis, riding the dirtbike, looks to his left into the Sonic Drive-In parking lot. The high school kids have gathered there again. He notices a rust colored Ford coup. The driver, an older kid named KYLE(18), sits beside May Pearl laughing. Ellis steers into traffic and crosses the street. He pulls onto a patch of grass at the edge of the Sonic parking lot. In one motion, Ellis tumps the bike on its side and makes a b- line for the coup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kyle's hand is on May Pearl's knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what'd she say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said she didn't like him that much. I told her I thought he was all right. Ellis appears with his elbows in the driver's side window. He sticks his head so far in the door that Kyle has to lean back in his seat to make room. May Pearl is surprised. Kyle snorts out a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get my phone calls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been callin' you. (motions with his head) Who's this guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your head outta my car kid. Ellis takes his right elbow and quickly knocks Kyle in the mouth. It splits his upper lip. Kyle grabs his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called you twice yesterday. Your sister didn't tell you? Kyle slings the door open knocking Ellis to the pavement. From the ground, Ellis can see that Kyle is big and considerably tougher than the skinny kid he punched before. Kyle's friends from other cars take notice and begin to converge on them. Ellis makes a move for Kyle's legs but is kicked back to the pavement. Kyle straddles him on the ground and punches him. Another punch to Ellis' face. May Pearl is out of the car and yelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kyle! Stop it Kyle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . May Pearl pulls Kyle by the collar. By his own will, he raises off of Ellis, keeping an eye on him. A streak of blood stretches from Ellis' nose to his ear. He gets to his feet, dazed. Ellis wipes at his nose and sees May Pearl shove Kyle. Kyle smiles and turns to his friends, who laugh. The CROWD that has collected consists of older high school guys and girls. Ellis steps toward May Pearl and is met with a shove too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doin' here Ellis?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just run up and punch people I'm with!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I just wanted to know why you hadn't called me back. I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would I call you back Ellis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're my girlfriend. The crowd is watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not your girlfriend! We went on one date. One!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We kissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That doesn't matter!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what Ellis?! What did you expect?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fourteen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. Wait. We can make this work. We can figure it out. I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Ellis is losing it. His eyes are red. He looks at the crowd of kids. There are smiles and some snickering. May Pearl is speechless. She just stares at him. Ellis turns and walks back to the dirt bike. May Pearl's girlfriends gather around her. She shakes her head, dumbstruck. Ellis lifts the bike off the ground. He looks back at May Pearl who appears to be shrugging off the whole affair in front of her friends. Ellis speeds off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELLIS' HOUSEBOAT/RIVERBANK - DAY 114 A fire snaps and pops on the riverbank next to Ellis' houseboat. Ellis drags a piece of particle board from a trash pile nearby. He drops the board onto the fire and stands back to watch the blaze. Neckbone's bike leans on a tree behind him. Senior's truck rattles to a stop in the gravel just down the bank. He jumps out of the cab exasperated by the fire his son has started by their home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doin'?! Ellis says nothing. He doesn't move. Senior, continuing to yell, runs and drags a hose up from the houseboat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis dammit! What the hell's wrong with you?! The fire hisses as Senior turns the hose on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? Look at me. Ellis finally looks up at his father. A phone RINGS from inside the houseboat. Senior holds the hose in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it. Put this damn thing out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Ellis takes the hose as Senior stomps on board to catch the phone. Ellis drops the hose. Senior's voice, speaking into the telephone, faintly carries outside. He's yelling. Ellis turns his head to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) I don't give a shit! Fine! I don't care what you do! I'm done with it! Ellis moves around the fire so he can see the houseboat through the flames. He hears the phone SLAM down. Senior appears at the back door. He stares at Ellis through the fire. Ellis moves to the side but realizes Senior isn't staring at him. He's staring at the fire. Senior disappears back into the house. There is a commotion. Ellis watches as Senior bursts out of the house holding an armful of woman's clothes. Senior walks up to the bonfire and begins tossing clothes on top piece by piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Ellis watches as dresses and blouses begin to shrivel up in the flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! That's mom's stuff! STOP IT! Ellis shoves at Senior. He easily counters the boy with his arm and continues tossing the clothes into the fire. Ellis is screaming and crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STOP IT! STOP! Ellis tries yanking the remaining clothes out of his father's hands but Senior shakes him off. Ellis stumbles. He watches with tears as Senior tosses all of the clothes on. Senior watches his wife's clothes burn. Ellis backs away to the bike. He climbs on, cranks the engine and speeds off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND SHORE - DAY 115 Ellis grounds the flat-bottom on shore and jumps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS/CREEK - DAY 116 Ellis thrashes through the woods. His muddy feet stomp across the fallen tree trunk that bridges the creek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND/SOUTHERN SHORE - DAY 117 The boat rests on its trailer on the edge of the bank. Mud stands on board looking down at the motor. Neckbone, tools in hand, has his head buried in the motor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try it now. Mud turns a switch. No result.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sonofabitch. Ellis emerges from the treeline. Mud sees him and hops down from the boat. He walks up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd she... Ellis punches Mud with as much force as he can muster. It's barely enough to turn Mud's face, but it stuns him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a liar. Makin' two kids run around doin' work you're too scared to do yourself. Makin' me tell her it's over `cause you're too scared to do it yourself. Mud steps back and gives the boy his space. Neckbone has made his way over and watches from behind Mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you loved her and you lied. You gave up on her and she gave up on you just like everybody else. I trusted you. Bonfires and crosses. Wolf's eye bullshit. Mud tries to approach him but the boy explodes, shoving him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EVERYTHING YOU'VE TOLD ME WAS A LIE! You never cared about her. You never cared about us. Not like you said. Not enough to matter. You used us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Ellis. Mud holds a hand out to him. Ellis slaps it away.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: YOU'VE TOLD ME WAS A LIE

direction.raw_text: You made me a thief! Ellis walks back into the woods. Mud exhales and turns back to Neckbone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS/CREEK - DAY 118 Ellis walks through the woods. Neckbone follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis! Ellis, stop for a second! Neckbone watches as Ellis reaches the tree trunk that bridges the creek. Ellis steps onto the log, but his muddy shoes miss a step. He SLIPS. Neckbone sees Ellis disappear down into the creek bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ELLIS! Neckbone rushes over. He cranes his neck out to peer over the edge, a solid eight foot drop into the creek. Ellis floats face up in the shallow water. He's unconscious. A wound on his head from a nearby rock. The nest of WATER MOCCASINS has been disturbed; SNAKES WRITHE AROUND ELLIS' BODY. Neckbone's eyes widen. He darts back toward the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND/SOUTHERN SHORE - DAY 119 Mud stands at the rear of the boat massaging his jaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! MUD! Mud hears the yelling. Neckbone explodes from the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MUD! ELLIS FELL! HE FELL IN THE CREEK! Mud rushes forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HE FELL INTO SNAKES! THE SNAKES! Mud stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MUD PLEASE! Mud looks around. His shirt hangs from a tree limb nearby. He snags it and darts into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ISLAND WOODS/CREEK - DAY 120 Mud streaks through the woods as he gets his other arm through the shirt sleeve. He reaches the creek. Without hesitating, Mud leaps down into the water, scoops Ellis into his arms and scales up the opposite side of the creek bed. Mud sprints for the north side of the island. Neckbone chases after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHERN SHORE AND RIVER - DAY 121 Mud cradles Ellis in his arms as he rushes to the flat-bottom boat. He sets Ellis gently inside. Neckbone on his heels. Mud shoves the boat into the water and hops in. Neckbone wades out and crawls up the side of the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the motor started. Neckbone cranks the motor. As they move up river, Mud searches Ellis' body. He looks at his neck, his arms, he pulls up his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?! Is he bit?! Mud notices Ellis' jeans leg riding up. He pulls the jeans back. A BITE in the middle of his calf. It's a bluish bruise with two distinct red dots. The skin around the bite has already begun to swell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He rips the jeans up to the thigh. Mud tears a section of cloth from the bottom of his own shirt and creates a tourniquet just below Ellis' knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said he couldn't watch it. He's pickin' me up in a minute. Got deliveries today. They sit in silence as the Workers exit off the houseboat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heard on the news. They still hadn't found Mud's body. Ellis nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he's dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I hope not. The crane begins lifting up the houseboat. The metal wires tighten and the entire structure creaks. A sucking sound as the flotilla separate from the water. The boat hangs, suspended in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind the boys. Ellis turns to see Senior's truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go. Come by the apartment. Help me set my room up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Neckbone watches Ellis climb into the bed of the pick-up and take his spot on the coolers. The sound of twisting metal shifts his attention back to the houseboat being swung over a flatbed semi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SENIOR'S TRUCK/RIVERBANK - CONTINUOUS 167 IN THE CAB, Senior glances at the houseboat being set on the flatbed. He puts the truck in reverse and pulls away. Not looking back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SENIOR'S TRUCK/IMAGES OF DEWITT - DAY 168 Ellis rides in the back of the truck on top of the coolers. He watches the town pass by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The marina junkyard. The Sonic. Downtown. A168 125.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FLEA MARKET - DAY B168 Ellis and his father unload a cooler at the back of a tented flea market. A WOMAN comes out to greet them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SENIOR'S TRUCK/NEW APARTMENTS - DAY 169 Senior's truck pulls into the parking lot of a newly finished apartment complex. The two-story buildings are modest. The truck idles out front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis grabs the door handle. He turns to Senior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you next week?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Ellis begins to get out but stops when Senior speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellis? You mind your mother okay? This is a big change for her. She needs your support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love you too. Ellis climbs out. He watches as Senior pulls away. He stands alone in front of the apartments, studying the surroundings. A busy road out front. A gas station and collection of stores. A lot of people and commotion. A compact car pulls into a parking spot one building down. Ellis watches as three COLLEGE AGE GIRLS climb out dressed in running shorts and t-shirts. Two are heavy set, the other is petite. They joke and laugh. One sees Ellis and waves. Ellis nods to her. He tracks them as they walk inside. Ellis smirks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MISSISSIPPI RIVER - DAY 170 The river rushes past. A large motor churns the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Tom stands steering Mud's salvaged boat down river. He cranes his neck, seeing something up ahead. Tom kills the motor. Looking out over the bow, he's pleased by what he sees. His eyes glint, almost a smile. He walks to the small cabin and enters.
direction.name: direction
